CLUE: Class of animal including spiders and scorpions
FOUND IN: Spiders belong to the class "Arachnida," while scorpions also fall under this classification but are more specifically categorized within the subclass "Scorpiones" due to their distinct anatomical features, such as having a segmented tail with a venomous stinger

CLUE: Threadlike strands growing from the skin
FOUND IN: Sebaceous trichomes: Microscopic hair-like structures found on sebaceous glands' surface that can appear threadlike and may be visible during dermatoscopic examination.
Sinbad: The main protagonist from the collection of Middle Eastern folk tales called "One Thousand and One Nights" (Arabian Nights).
Archer: As a reference to the character "Jeffrey Tracy" from the television series Thunderbirds who is an expert archer known as International Oil's "Bowman."

CLUE: Concerted operation to sully someone's name

FOUND IN: New Rome: Refers directly to the modern-day city, Istanbul in Turkey, which was historically known as Byzantium and later renamed Constantinople after Emperor Constantine the Great
